title: Dark matter from axions with connection to neutrino mass
abstract:
We explore a KSVZ-like extension of the Standard Model with a Dirac fermion
and three right-handed neutrinos. PQ symmetry allows the Dirac mass for
neutrinos and prevents the Majorana mass. A $\mathcal{Z}_2$ symmetry guarantees
the stability of Dirac fermion dark matter. The breakdown of PQ symmetry
generates the QCD axion at a high scale. The fermion dark matter relic
abundance arises from the UV-freeze-in mechanism through the axion portal. We
determine the fermion DM relic by solving stiff Boltzmann equations and finding
the allowed parameter space using the relic density constraints. Having
determined the allowed parameter space for fermion DM, we also look for the
two-component scenario where the axion produced from the misalignment mechanism
can co-exist as DM too. We find that both FIMP and axion dark matter have
sufficient parameter space that is not excluded while considering several
current bounds and future sensitivities on axion and dark matter. Our study
highlights the interlinking of dark matter, axion, and neutrinos while
addressing the strong CP problem and small neutrino masses.
